text: Arthur John Child (September 15, 1915 â€“ June 30, 1996) was a British goaltender who played professional ice hockey in the United Kingdom. He was the backup goaltender for the GB national ice hockey team which won gold at the 1936 Winter Olympics (see Ice hockey at the 1936 Winter Olympics). Child himself did not take to the ice during the tournament and was not awarded a gold medal. He is a member of the British Ice Hockey Hall of Fame. ==References== British Ice Hockey Hall of Fame entry Category:1916 births Category:1996 deaths Category:English ice hockey players Category:Sportspeople from Essex
title: Art Child
